note:
Guy who forgot what he wrote on his old bio before moving accounts, before finding that he could access his old bio using the Husky app by searching for his old account.

Programmer who is also interested in cybersecurity. Plays videogames quite a bit.

Tech nerd, generally prefers open-source software. Uses Debian 11, and will not touch Windows outside of a VM.

Trying to install spyware on any device I use will likely result in you eating crow (figuratively, not literally) after the spyware gets reverse engineered and the device hacked (if I don't already have root), if I cannot outright block its installation.

Casually using #sh1mmer so I can install Mrchromebox altfw and dual-boot an actual Linux distro (ok its definitely a meme distro) on what once was a managed chromebook. It's not managed any more™

Mercury Workshop is awesome!

(moving my account here while I do maintenance on my own fedi server)

value: not literally the best exploit ever found, sh1mmer is objectively better.
